alert.note: Alert for Menominee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 5:05AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Slippery Roads Expected Across the Area for the Morning Commute... Accumulating snowfall will continue across central and north- central Wisconsin this morning, and spread eastwards across the Fox Valley between 5 to 7am. Snowfall will create slippery roads and hazardous travel conditions for the morning commute across the area. Total snowfall amounts across the area between 1 to 3 inches of snow are expected, tapering off at most locations during the late morning or early afternoon. For central and north-central Wisconsin, light snowfall accumulations have already fallen. Slick spots are likely through the remainder of the morning, especially on raised surfaces such as bridges, which may have icy spots under the snow. For the Fox Valley, higher snowfall rates will arrive during the morning commute, which will deteriorate road conditions and lower visibility. Be prepared for changing conditions! Be sure to use caution on your commute in the morning, and allow yourself extra time to reach your destination.
